intro: Astronidium ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaved Astronidium, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small evergreen shrub native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical forests. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains numerous seeds.
